verbose_text: In the Cox regression model, each 1-SD increase in QTc was associated with an 18% increase in risk for all-cause mortality (HR 1.18 [95% CI 1.03-1.36]; P = 0.02] after controlling for ethnicity, sex, hypertension, antihypertensive medications, BMI, diabetes duration, HbA 1c level, current smoking status, total cholesterol level, triglyceride level, eGFR, and baseline CVD status in the fully adjusted model (XREF_TABLE).
